src:
首相、文大統領に「日本の原則的立場」伝える

04 Nov 2019, 04:35

　【バンコク＝池田慶太】日本政府は４日、バンコクで開かれている東南アジア諸国連合（ＡＳＥＡＮ）関連首脳会議の会場内で、安倍首相が韓国の文在寅（ムンジェイン）大統領と約１０分間、言葉を交わしたと発表した。
　発表によると、両首脳は、日中韓３か国とＡＳＥＡＮとの首脳会議に先立ち、会場内の首脳控室で接触した。その際、首相は文氏に対し、「二国間問題に関する日本の原則的立場」を伝えた。元徴用工らの請求権問題は１９６５年の日韓請求権・経済協力協定で解決済みとの立場を改めて説明し、韓国側に適切な対応を求めたとみられる。
　また首相は、文氏の母親が死去したことに弔意を伝え、韓国政府が１０月の「即位礼正殿の儀」に李洛淵（イナギョン）首相を派遣したことに謝意を述べた。文氏は、弔意への謝意と、天皇陛下即位に対する祝意を表明した。
　両首脳は３日夜、ＡＳＥＡＮ関連会合の夕食会の開始前、集合写真を撮影する際に笑顔で握手を交わしている。
text:
Prime Minister, “Principal position of Japan” is conveyed to President Moon

04 Nov 2019, 04:35

[Bangkok = Keita Ikeda] The Japanese government will speak with Prime Minister Abe for about 10 minutes at the meeting of the Southeast Asian Nations Association (ASEAN) summit held in Bangkok on the 4th. We announced that we exchanged.
According to the announcement, the two leaders contacted the leaders in the venue prior to the summit between ASEAN and Japan. At that time, the Prime Minister told Mr. Fumi about "Japan's principle position on bilateral issues". It seems that he has reexamined his claim that the problem of claiming rights by former contributors has been resolved in the 1965 Japan-Korea Claims / Economic Cooperation Agreement, and has urged the Korean side to take appropriate measures.
The Prime Minister also expressed his appreciation for the death of Mr. Wen ’s mother, and thanked the Korean government for sending Prime Minister Inagyeong to the “Ceremonial Court of the Throne” in October. Mr. Bun expressed appreciation for the allegiance and congratulations to the Emperor.
“The two leaders are shaking hands with a smile when taking a group photo on the evening of the 3rd, before the start of the ASEAN-related dinner.
